If you are a fan of Zorro, Indiana Jones, or action in general this is a must-see. Directed by Republic's ace team of William Witney and John England and starring John ‘Daredevil’ Carroll, this movie knows that one doesn’t need to weigh things down with a brilliant plot (Spaniards dishonorably conquer Indians and so the Americans take revenge on them) so that the action can explode abundantly, and is almost always on the screen

A woman who hates cats (Alice Krige) and her son (Brian Krause) have moved into a small town, and must deal with a mean cat. The film, based on a short story by Raymond Carver, uses flashbacks to explain the origins of the hatred and ultimately what drives and fuels the mother’s rage. The Film and Screenplay was executively produced by Glenn Morshower.<|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|>
